data.title: Jonah Hill: From ‘Superbad’ to Serious Director

data.text:
By Richard Waters

Jonah Hill’s first film as a director starts in an empty corridor: a boy is hurled out of his bedroom by his older brother, who then throws him on the floor and starts to punch him hard. The single take makes it shocking but Hill says it was also emotionally challenging. “You have a really kind, wonderful 20-year-old actor beating the shit out of an 11-year-old boy. There’s many ways to do that with stunt people or camera tricks but, because it’s one shot and doesn’t cut away, it’s all in the physicality of the actors.”

Hill is steeped in the language of film. He had one of those childhoods that you imagine for someone brought up in Los Angeles on the fringes of the entertainment business; his mother was a costume designer and his father a tour accountant for the rock band Guns N’Roses.
